titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Joseph J. Mooney theatre programs and James Miller scrapbook 1977.290
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-08-08 13:12:04 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Joseph J. Mooney theatre programs and James Miller scrapbook
did.abstract: Loose programs and a scrapbook of programs and clippings relating to performances at various Brooklyn theatres in the 1870s-1880s. The scrapbook also includes many photographic portraits of actors associated with the programs.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The loose programs were the gift of Joseph J. Mooney, 1931. The scrapbook was the gift of James Miller, 1974.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Joseph J. Mooney was born circa 1860. He was one of the incorporators of the Brooklyn City Savings and Loan Corporation and served as its president from 1927-1933. In 1935, it was converted into the Brooklyn Federal Savings and Loan Association. At the time of Mooney's death in 1938 at age 78, he was chairman of the executive committee of the Association's board of directors. He lived at 751 Westminster Road, Brooklyn.

list.head: Source:
list.item: "Joseph J. Mooney" [obituary]. The New York Times, August 17, 1938, p. 19.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Joseph J. Mooney theatre programs and James Miller scrapbook, 1977.290; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level. This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024. At that time, preservation photocopies were created of three of the loose programs, as well as news clippings from the scrapbook, and the originals discarded. The collection was also renamed to reflect documentation in the accession file indicating that the scrapbook was the gift of James Miller.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Loose programs and a scrapbook of programs and clippings relating to performances at various Brooklyn theaters in the 1870s-1880s. Items also relate to the Brooklyn Theatre Fire. The scrapbook also includes many photographic portraits of actors associated with the programs. There are also programs from some Manhattan theaters and one each from Washington, D.C. and Philadelphia.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain.
